summary: Email chain between an FBI agent and an Assistant U.S. Attorney discussing overseas victim notifications related to Jeffrey Epstein's release. The FBI agent reports on the status of notifications to victims in Bogota and Australia, mentions a Bank of America employee facing difficulties for contacting the FBI, and references attorney Alan D. and Br Stns.

persons.name: Alan D.
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of the FBI agent's email, suggesting that issues with a Bank of America employee's SAR (Suspicious Activity Report) may relate more to this attorney and 'Br Stns' than to Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the victim notifications; the emails discuss notifying overseas victims of his release.

connections.description: Implied connection as attorney Alan D. is mentioned in the context of issues surrounding Epstein's case, specifically regarding a Bank of America SAR.

events.title: Overseas Victim Notifications
events.description: Email correspondence regarding the status of victim notifications to overseas individuals following Jeffrey Epstein's release.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from December 4, 2008, discussing overseas victim notifications related to Jeffrey Epstein's release.
An FBI agent reports that Bogota authorities received a notification letter and would deliver it, and plans to contact Australia.
A Bank of America employee is facing difficulties from their employer for contacting the FBI but is still working on a Suspicious Activity Report (SAR).
The FBI agent suggests that issues with the Bank of America SAR may relate more to attorney Alan D. and 'Br Stns' than to Epstein.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney needs to send notifications of Epstein's release to overseas victims and is verifying addresses.
